text: date: wed 12/15/1999 11:19 am from: krispen malonebeach (kripen5@earthlink.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: male/female brainis fifteen people really an adequate sample size upon which to base a press release about this? ("why men see things differently," 14.dec.1999). if the ap news and the networks get hold of it they will have "men are from mars, women are from venus" crapola all over the place again. in my opinion, reporting on science issues is frequently garbled and irresponsible. i am concerned that releasing interpretations of data that are at best speculative, only makes the problem worse. it was not that long ago that girls were told that they were just naturally bad at math and science. there are plenty of people out there who would love for a "scientific" study to support their own backwards attitudes so that they can start treating people unfairly with impunity all over again.i also have to ask, who was included in your study? did you include any mathematicians, auto-mechanics, or social workers, and what were their genders? perhaps i don
